answers.content_html: In a good-quality speaker, sounds with high frequencies or short wavelengths are reproduced accurately by woofers, while sounds with low frequencies or long wavelengths are reproduced accurately by tweeters.
answers.feedback_html: Sounds with shorts wavelengths cannot be accurately reproduced by woofers, and sounds with long wavelengths cannot be accurately reproduced by tweeters.

answers.content_html: Sounds with high frequencies or short wavelengths are reproduced more accurately by tweeters, while sounds with low frequencies or long wavelengths are reproduced more accurately by woofers.
answers.feedback_html: Small speakers or tweeters are best for reproducing sounds with short wavelengths. Large speakers or woofers are best for reproducing sounds with long wavelengths.
